message_1:
Sure, here's a problem for a math student to solve:

The hash function SHA-256 produces a 256-bit hash value. If you have a message of length 2000 bits, what will be the length of the hash value?
message_2: The length of the hash value produced by the SHA-256 hash function will always be 256 bits, regardless of the length of the input message. So, for a message of length 2000 bits, the length of the hash value will still be 256 bits.
